snippet: The legislation allows for the construction of a new $700 million bridge between Minnesota and Wisconsin. The project has drawn comparisons to earmarks.
abstract: House overwhelmingly approves legislation to allow construction of a new $700 million bridge between Minnesota and Wisconsin, a project that has drawn comparisons to other earmarks and required a Congressional exemption from a landmark environmental law; vote is 339 to 80, with 16 Republicans and 64 Democrats voting against the measure.
lead_paragraph: The legislation allows for the construction of a new $700 million bridge between Minnesota and Wisconsin. The project has drawn comparisons to earmarks.

headline.seo: After Earmark Debate, House Votes to Replace Stillwater Bridge
headline.main: House Passes Bridge Bill After an Earmark Debate
headline.print_headline: House Passes Bridge Bill After an Earmark Debate
